data.title: Thailand launches new relief initiative to tackle household debts
data.description: The ‘You Fight, We Help’ project aims to help 1.9 million people deal with loans taken to buy a home, car or run a small business

data.title: SEA-TEP Model: Shaping the Future of Teacher Education
data.description: Teachers are the cornerstone of shaping future generations to tackle 21st-century challenges. Recognizing their pivotal role,  SEAMEO STEM-ED (The Southeast Asian Ministers of Education Organization Regional Centre for STEM Education),  through the Chevron-funded education initiative, has launched the  SEA-TEP (Southeast Asian Teacher Education Program)  in Thailand, Cambodia, Indonesia, Kazakhstan, and Malaysia to equip teachers with essential practices to deliver high-quality instruction related to STEM, setting a benchmark for regional and global education transformation through teacher education and development from the upstream.

data.title: 1 killed in fatal wild elephant attack in Phu Kradueng
data.description: National park officials say there are plenty of signs warning people to stay away from the area where the 49-year-old was reportedly killed

data.title: Thresher shark found beached on Koh Phi Phi  returned to sea
data.description: The staff of the Had Noppharat Thara-Mu Ko Phi Phi National Park and local villagers saved a thresher shark on Wednesday that was found beached on Phi Phi Don Island on Tuesday, and safely returned it to the sea.

data.title: Phiphat confident THB400 minimum wage will start from Jan 1
data.description: Labour minister also hints at other New Year gifts for Thai people

data.title: Philippine VP doubts she will survive impeachment
data.description: MANILA - Philippine Vice President  Sara Duterte  expressed doubts on Wednesday about getting enough support from legislators to fight  impeachment  complaints filed against her, saying the process is a “political activity”.

data.title: Tourist killed by wild elephant in Phu Kradueng park
data.description: A tourist was killed by a wild elephant in Phu Krabueng National Park on Tuesday, and alarmed officials declared some areas closed to visitors.

data.title: PEA rules out irregularities in overseas electricity distribution
data.description: Deputy governor vows PEA will act if any illegal activities come to light

data.title: The art of falling mid-air
data.description: Moca Bangkok presents "In Just A Blink Of An Eye", a thought-provoking performance piece by renowned Chinese contemporary artist Xu Zhen.

data.title: Motor Expo 2024 sees record bookings despite market challenges
data.description: Toyota leads the bookings followed by BYD and Honda, reflecting growing consumer interest despite challenges from stricter lending policies

data.title: No tolls on Pak Chong-Korat M6 Motorway during 5-day New Year break
data.description: The Highways Department waives toll fees to ensure motorists heading to the Northeast can bypass heavy traffic in the heart of Nakhon Ratchasima

data.title: Festive Brilliance at lebua: A New Luxury Era
data.description: This festive season, lebua Hotels & Resorts ushers in a transformative era, redefining luxury and excitement for Bangkok’s holiday celebrations. From December 16, 2024, to January 5, 2025, lebua presents an unparalleled festive programme, blending fine dining, cutting-edge entertainment, and breathtaking panoramic views.

data.title: Foxconn subsidiary gets BOI privileges to build factories in Thailand
data.description: Taiwanese firm to establish two semiconductor factories in Chonburi and Rayong, with an investment of 10.5 billion baht, creating over 1,400 jobs

data.title: Hong Kong targets EV transition for franchised buses, taxis in B2.6bn push
data.description: Hong Kong authorities will dish out more than HK$600 million (2.6 billion baht) to help franchised bus companies and the taxi industry procure electric vehicles (EVs) under a plan to achieve zero vehicular emissions and carbon neutrality by 2050.

data.title: Bail upheld for Thai MP appealing lese-majeste conviction
data.description: Rukchanok Srinork , a People’s Party MP who is appealing convictions for  lese-majeste  and computer crime, on Wednesday survived an attempt to have her  bail  revoked.

data.title: Efforts to block malicious apps declared successful
data.description: Ministry of Digital Economy and Society teams up with Google to shield Thai internet users from dangerous cyber threats

data.title: Luxury, wellness, romance: TAT’s strategy to capture elite tourists
data.description: TAT aims to boost tourism revenue by promoting events unique to Thailand in high-spending markets like the US, China and the Middle East

data.title: Patient dies after brutal treatment by hospital staff
data.description: SI SA KET - A 31-year-old patient suffering from alcohol withdrawal died after allegedly being brutalised by staff at the hospital where he was being treated.

data.title: Celebrating Sustainability: The Thailanders Honours Top Achievers
data.description: The Thailanders,  Thailand’s premier bilingual media platform, led by Editor-in-Chief Amornsiri Boonyasit, celebrated its 8th anniversary with the  “The Thailanders Top Business Organizations & Social Impact Sustainability Awards 2024.”  The prestigious event honoured 26 exceptional organisations and individuals for their significant contributions to Thailand’s economic growth and sustainable development. Held at the Park Hyatt Bangkok, the awards ceremony was presided over by  Mr Sanan Angubolkul,  Chairman of the Thai Chamber of Commerce and Board of Trade of Thailand.

data.title: Capstone Asset Launches Peylaa Phuket: Luxury Redefined
data.description: Capstone Asset Co., Ltd. has unveiled Peylaa Phuket Bang Tao, a THB 3.4 billion luxury condominium project in the iconic Bang Tao neighbourhood. Known for its vibrant lifestyle and world-class attractions, Bang Tao is home to this new development designed to offer a refined living experience. Located near popular destinations like Boat Avenue, golf courses, international schools, and shopping malls, Peylaa Phuket is poised to become a sought-after address for discerning buyers.

data.title: Sansiri Unveils "The Society": Embracing Phukets Soft Power On The Global Stage
data.description: SANSIRI PHUKET + THE SOCIETY brings new vibrant energy to Phuket with the launch of “The Society”, highlighting local soft power through art, cultural heritage, beach sports, kite surfing, cuisine and sustainable practices, writes Atiya Achakulwisut.

data.title: New releases for your streaming pleasure: Dec 11-17
data.description: Looking for a title to binge-watch this weekend? Here

data.title: New era dawns for Thai brand Pañpuri
data.description: Thailand’s leading fragrance and wellness brand to spread its international wings following acquisition by Japan’s Kosé Group

data.title: Photo exhibit by HRH Princess Maha Chakri Sirindhorn goes live
data.description: ‘Free at Last’ presents 150 images captured outdoors during 2024 and can be enjoyed until March 16

data.title: Blending ancient culture and modern luxury
data.description: There is no dearth of spas or wellness centres in Thailand or even in the capital city. Though finding the gems in a country renowned for its wellness programmes is rare. Take a moment to relax in prep for the new year.

data.title: Bosch Supports Thailand’s EV Progress at TEBA Panel
data.description: Dubbed “Southeast Asia’s EV Pioneer,” Thailand’s electric vehicle (EV) market has made significant strides over the years, achieving a six percent growth in the first 10 months of 2024, despite a global slowdown in EV adoption.

data.title: S. Korean ex-defence minister tried to kill himself
data.description: SEOUL - South Korea

data.title: PROUD REAL ESTATE Unveils ‘ALL IS WELL’ Vision
data.description: PROUD REAL ESTATE  a leading developer in the luxury real estate sector, is revolutionising the Thai property landscape with its visionary "ALL IS WELL" concept. Delivering Holistic, Sustainable Living Solutions. Discover an Elevated Living Experience through World-Class Designs that Prioritise Residents’ Well-Being and Environmental Harmony, Comprehensive Amenities for Ultimate Relaxation, Personalised Services for Residents, and Eco-Friendly Lifestyles. Announcing plans for 2025, PROUD will launch three new projects across Bangkok suburbs, Hua Hin, and Phuket, valued at 9.2 billion baht, setting a revenue target of 10 billion baht, achieving exponential growth. Reaffirm  ESG commitments  by transforming projects and operations towards sustainability. Aim for Net Zero emissions by 2050, while continuously improving community well-being and enhancing business potential to meet the criteria of the THAI ESG fund in the future.

data.title: No one damaged by The iCon Group, says jailed CEO
data.description: Letter from jail penned by the group’s founder and posted on Facebook insists he is innocent of the charges and vows to explain further

data.title: Pheu Thai's Prayuth, crusader against military coups
data.description: Pheu Thai Party list-MP Prayuth Siripanich has been in the limelight following his proposal to amend the Defence Ministry Administration Act, aiming to reduce the military

data.title: Pheu Thai's Prayuth, crusader against military coups

data.title: Ex-DPM Wissanu says skip charter referendum
data.description: The charter should be amended section by section to avoid having to conduct a referendum, as the focus should be on forming an assembly to redraft the constitution, according to legal experts.

data.title: Thailand’s vintage collectables find a home at House of Museums 2
data.description: Established by National Artist Anek Nawigamune and his wife Wanna, this community-driven museum celebrates the kingdom’s rich cultural heritage
